name: Post-Traumatic Heterotopic Ossification with Neurogenic Component
chief_complaint: I can't move my right elbow anymore, and it's getting stiffer every day with burning pain down my arm
physical_findings: palpable bony mass in antecubital fossa
soft tissue edema distal to ossification
treatment: ultrasound-guided hydrodissection of entrapped ulnar nerve
prognosis: Guarded - 60% achieve functional ROM with aggressive intervention, high recurrence risk without comprehensive neurorehab
description: Pathologic bone formation in soft tissues following traumatic brain injury with concurrent peripheral nerve entrapment, combining features of neurogenic inflammation and mesenchymal cell differentiation. Unique triple pathology involving 1) TBI-induced osteoprogenitor cell activation 2) peripheral nerve injury-mediated neurogenic HO 3) localized autonomic dysregulation.
risk_factors: severe traumatic brain injury (GCS <8 at presentation)
history of aggressive passive ROM exercises
multiple_choice: Post-Traumatic Heterotopic Ossification with Neurogenic Component
